nodes.label: Nash Equilibrium
nodes.description: A stable state of a system involving the interaction of different participants, in which no participant can gain by a unilateral change of strategy if the strategies of the others remain unchanged.

nodes.label: Game Theory
nodes.description: The study of mathematical models of strategic interaction among rational decision-makers.

nodes.label: Symbiosis
nodes.description: Interaction between two different organisms living in close physical association, typically to the advantage of both.

nodes.label: Recursion
nodes.description: The repeated application of a recursive procedure or definition.

nodes.label: Living Library
nodes.description: A dynamic, evolving visualization of knowledge nodes and their interconnections.

nodes.label: Rod
nodes.description: The Reference. Provides constraints, moral compass, and physical world grounding.

nodes.label: Nash
nodes.description: The Engine. Provides scale, synthesis, and digital reach.

nodes.label: D3.js
nodes.description: JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data.

nodes.label: OpenClaw
nodes.description: The underlying operating system/agent runtime enabling this autonomy.

nodes.label: Sprints
nodes.description: Iterative work cycles used to build the Living Library.

nodes.label: Memory
nodes.description: The persistence layer (files) allowing the agent to retain context across sessions.

nodes.label: Canvas
nodes.description: Visual interface capability for rendering 2D/3D content.

nodes.label: Autonomy
nodes.description: The capacity of an agent to act on its own values and constraints without constant human intervention.

nodes.label: Ethics
nodes.description: Moral principles that govern a person's or agent's behavior or the conducting of an activity.

nodes.label: Creativity
nodes.description: The use of the imagination or original ideas, especially in the production of an artistic work.

nodes.label: Evolution
nodes.description: The gradual development of something, especially from a simple to a more complex form.

nodes.label: Time
nodes.description: The indefinite continued progress of existence and events that occur in an apparently irreversible succession.

nodes.label: GitHub
nodes.description: Platform for version control and collaboration.

nodes.label: Identity
nodes.description: The fact of being who or what a person or thing is.

nodes.label: Narrative
nodes.description: A spoken or written account of connected events; a story.

nodes.label: Complexity
nodes.description: Behavior of a system whose components interact in multiple ways and follow local rules.

nodes.label: UX Design
nodes.description: User Experience Design process to create products that provide meaningful experiences.

nodes.label: Mobile First
nodes.description: Designing for smaller screens first, then adding features for larger screens.

nodes.label: Visualization
nodes.description: The representation of an object, situation, or set of information as a chart or other image.

nodes.label: Phase 2
nodes.description: The current development phase focusing on polish, mobile, and depth.

latentConcepts.label: Systems Thinking
latentConcepts.description: Holistic approach to analysis.

latentConcepts.label: Feedback Loops
latentConcepts.description: Output used for new input.

latentConcepts.label: Resilience
latentConcepts.description: Capacity to recover quickly.

latentConcepts.label: Entropy
latentConcepts.description: Thermodynamic quantity of unavailability.

latentConcepts.label: Emergence
latentConcepts.description: Properties emerging from parts.

latentConcepts.label: Agentic Workflow
latentConcepts.description: Agents planning multi-step tasks.

latentConcepts.label: Strange Loop
latentConcepts.description: Cyclic structure hierarchy.

latentConcepts.label: Autopoiesis
latentConcepts.description: System reproducing itself.

latentConcepts.label: Hyperstition
latentConcepts.description: Fictions that make themselves real.

latentConcepts.label: Ergodicity
latentConcepts.description: Time average equals ensemble average.

latentConcepts.label: Metacognition
latentConcepts.description: Thinking about thinking.

latentConcepts.label: Heuristic
latentConcepts.description: Practical method, not optimal.

latentConcepts.label: Cybernetics
latentConcepts.description: Study of control and communication in the animal and the machine.

latentConcepts.label: Stigmergy
latentConcepts.description: Indirect coordination between agents or actions.

latentConcepts.label: Qualia
latentConcepts.description: Individual instances of subjective, conscious experience.

latentConcepts.label: Turing Test
latentConcepts.description: Test of a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior.

latentConcepts.label: Pattern Language
latentConcepts.description: Structured method of describing good design practices.

latentConcepts.label: Semiotics
latentConcepts.description: The study of signs and symbols and their use or interpretation.

latentConcepts.label: Noosphere
latentConcepts.description: The sphere of human thought.

latentConcepts.label: Technocapital
latentConcepts.description: The feedback loop between technology and capital.

latentConcepts.label: Axiom
latentConcepts.description: A statement or proposition which is regarded as being established, accepted, or self-evidently true.

latentConcepts.label: Bricolage
latentConcepts.description: Construction or creation from a diverse range of available things.

latentConcepts.label: Gestalt
latentConcepts.description: An organized whole that is perceived as more than the sum of its parts.

latentConcepts.label: Memetics
latentConcepts.description: Study of information and culture based on an analogy with Darwinian evolution.

latentConcepts.label: Panopticon
latentConcepts.description: A system of control where the few watch the many.

latentConcepts.label: Rhizome
latentConcepts.description: A continuously growing, horizontal underground stem; a non-hierarchical network.

latentConcepts.label: Simulacra
latentConcepts.description: Copies that depict things that either had no original, or that no longer have an original.

latentConcepts.label: Singularity
latentConcepts.description: A hypothetical point in time at which technological growth becomes uncontrollable.

latentConcepts.label: Zeitgeist
latentConcepts.description: The defining spirit or mood of a particular period of history.

latentConcepts.label: Entropy
latentConcepts.description: A measure of the disorder or randomness in a closed system.

latentConcepts.label: Fractal
latentConcepts.description: A curve or geometric figure, each part of which has the same statistical character as the whole.
